High voltage: Man risks electrocution by moving network power wires during outage https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/high-Voltage-man-risks-electriccution-by-moving-network-power-wires-during-outage/JQXXQ3QHYNECPNLTEU3CSMPD5M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/high-Voltage-man-risks-electriccution-by-moving-network-power-wires-during-outage/JQXXQ3QHYNECPNLTEU3CSMPD5M/ Belinda FeekThe man would have been handling live wires if the power had been turned back on. Tue, 17 Oct 2023 07:00:00 +0000 Karapiro man David McLennan moved Waipā Network's power lines and wires during a planned outage in April last year. He was prosecuted by the Electrical Workers Registration Board and was fined today when he was sentenced in the Hamilton District Court. Photo / Thinkstock

Auckland sewer sinkhole: Parnell bypass done but beaches stay closed with sewage overflows set to continue https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-sewer-sinkhole-parnell-bypass-done-but-beaches-stay-close-with-sewage-overflows-set-to-continue/HOLZX63XUZCQVOHK7ACAIMG65Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-sewer-sinkhole-parnell-bypass-done-but-beaches-stay-close-with-sewage-overflows-set-to-continue/HOLZX63XUZCQVOHK7ACAIMG65Q/ Raphael FranksWhile the city hit a 23C high today, a least 22 beaches remain closed in the Waitematā. Tue, 17 Oct 2023 06:01:41 +0000 Watercare has today completed a bypass around a blocked Auckland sewer main, which saw a massive sinkhole open under St George's Bay Rd in Parnell. Photo / Watercare
Te Wairongoa Paniona, Northland’s beloved street busker, in hospital after alleged hit-and-run https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/te-wairongoa-paniona-northlands-beloved-street-busker-in-hospital-after-alleged-hit-and-run-crash/ZQV2IHIJFJCMPGYPA735YDVCSQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/te-wairongoa-paniona-northlands-beloved-street-busker-in-hospital-after-alleged-hit-and-run-crash/ZQV2IHIJFJCMPGYPA735YDVCSQ/ Avneesh Vincent"As whānau, we can only hope for him to get well soon." Tue, 17 Oct 2023 06:00:00 +0000 In the early hours of Sunday, October 15, Te Wairongoa Paniona was the victim of a hit-and-run while he was riding his mobility scooter in Cairnfield Rd, Whangārei.
